medical_history.chief_complaint: Early onset gout and mild renal insufficiency.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initially manifested as articular gout at age 10. Mild renal insufficiency diagnosed later. At age 31, patient had creatinine clearance of 46 ml/min and abnormal liver tests noted. Diagnosed with mild fasting hyperglycemia at age 36, which worsened despite diet and weight loss.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Maturity Onset Diabetes of the Young Type 5 (MODY5), including hyperuricemic nephropathy, chronic renal failure, and early gout.
medical_history.family_history: Proband’s father had diabetes diagnosed at age 45 and chronic renal failure at age 59. Family history of chronic renal failure noted in the proband’s aunt and grandmother.
